sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the Abuse Prevention
Review
Team Act.

sections.heading: State policy. The following statements are the policy of this
Definitions. As used in this Act, unless the context requires
Residential health care facility resident sexual assault and
Reviews of nursing home resident sexual assaults and deaths.
sections.text: Reviews of nursing home resident sexual assaults and deaths.

sections.heading: Indemnification.
sections.text:
The State shall indemnify and hold harmless
members of a review team and
the Executive Council for all their acts, omissions, decisions, or other
conduct
arising out of the scope of their service on the review team or Executive
Council,
except
those involving willful or wanton misconduct. The method of providing
indemnification shall be as provided in the State Employee Indemnification Act.

sections.heading: Department's annual report. The Department shall include in its annual Long-Term Care Report to the General Assembly a report of the activities of the review teams and Executive Council, the results of the review teams' findings, recommendations made to the Department by the review teams and the Exe
sections.text: Department's annual report. The Department shall include in its annual Long-Term Care Report to the General Assembly a report of the activities of the review teams and Executive Council, the results of the review teams' findings, recommendations made to the Department by the review teams and the Executive Council, and, as applicable, either (i) the implementation of the recommendations or (ii) the reasons the recommendations were not implemented.

sections.heading: Funding. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, to the extent permitted by federal law, the Department shall use moneys from fines paid by facilities licensed under the Nursing Home Care Act, the Specialized Mental Health Rehabilitation Act of 2013, the ID/DD Community Care Act, or the MC/DD Ac
sections.text: Funding. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, to the extent permitted by federal law, the Department shall use moneys from fines paid by facilities licensed under the Nursing Home Care Act, the Specialized Mental Health Rehabilitation Act of 2013, the ID/DD Community Care Act, or the MC/DD Act for violating requirements for certification under Titles XVIII and XIX of the Social Security Act to implement the provisions of this Act. The Department shall use moneys deposited in the Long Term Care Monitor/Receiver Fund to pay the costs of implementing this Act that cannot be met by the use of federal civil monetary penalties.

sections.heading: Relationship to other Acts.
sections.text:
Nothing in this Act is intended to
conflict
with or duplicate provisions of other Acts or rules implementing other Acts.

sections.heading: Effective date.
sections.text: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
